input: <web-search mcp-server="ydc-server">Find current information about: document image augmentation OCR text similarity 2024</web-search>
output:
Here are current 2024 sources and what they say about document image augmentation, OCR, and text‑similarity evaluation:

- OCR2SEQ (Journal of Big Data, 2024) proposes a multi‑modal augmentation pipeline that turns text into mock scanned documents, injects realistic OCR errors, then trains seq2seq models to denoise; it evaluates augmentation quality with CER/WER and edit‑distance distributions, positioning augmentation as central to OCR robustness in domain‑specific data. https://journalofbigdata.springeropen.com/articles/10.1186/s40537-024-00927-4
- A 2024 systematic review of data augmentation for offline handwritten text recognition (HTR) finds classic image transforms still dominate, while GAN‑based handwriting synthesis is rising; it’s a 2024 survey that frames augmentation as a key solution when labeled data is scarce. https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s42979-023-02583-6
- CLOCR‑C (arXiv 2024) applies LLMs for post‑OCR correction and reports large CER reductions on historical documents; it also measures downstream quality with Cosine Named Entity Similarity, giving a concrete 2024 example of text‑similarity‑style evaluation linked to OCR correction. https://arxiv.org/abs/2408.17428
- A 2024 ACL LaTeCH‑CLfL paper evaluates 14 LLMs for post‑correction and finds they’re often inefficient, stressing that not all LLM‑based OCR correction helps—useful context when pairing augmentation with correction. https://aclanthology.org/2024.latechclfl-1.14/

If you want, I can dig into any of these papers for specific methods, datasets, or quantitative results and compile a more detailed literature summary or comparison table.

trajectory.content:

- OCR2SEQ (Journal of Big Data, 2024) proposes a multi‑modal augmentation pipeline that turns text into mock scanned documents, injects realistic OCR errors, then trains seq2seq models to denoise; it evaluates augmentation quality with CER/WER and edit‑distance distributions, positioning augmentation as central to OCR robustness in domain‑specific data. https://journalofbigdata.springeropen.com/articles/10.1186/s40537-024-00927-4
- A 2024 systematic review of data augmentation for offline handwritten text recognition (HTR) finds classic image transforms still dominate, while GAN‑based handwriting synthesis is rising; it’s a 2024 survey that frames augmentation as a key solution when labeled data is scarce. https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s42979-023-02583-6
- CLOCR‑C (arXiv 2024) applies LLMs for post‑OCR correction and reports large CER reductions on historical documents; it also measures downstream quality with Cosine Named Entity Similarity, giving a concrete 2024 example of text‑similarity‑style evaluation linked to OCR correction. https://arxiv.org/abs/2408.17428
- A 2024 ACL LaTeCH‑CLfL paper evaluates 14 LLMs for post‑correction and finds they’re often inefficient, stressing that not all LLM‑based OCR correction helps—useful context when pairing augmentation with correction. https://aclanthology.org/2024.latechclfl-1.14/

If you want, I can dig into any of these papers for specific methods, datasets, or quantitative results and compile a more detailed literature summary or comparison table.

input: <web-search mcp-server="ydc-server">Find current information about: 한국 정부사이트 PDF 다운로드 curl SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL 해결 2026</web-search>
output:
찾은 건 전반적 SSL 오류/정부24 접속 문제 글들뿐이라 “한국 정부사이트 PDF 다운로드 + curl + SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL + 2026”에 직접 매칭되는 최신 공식 자료는 확인되지 않아요. 대신 바로 적용 가능한 해결책 위주로 정리해드릴게요.

- `curl`에서 `SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL`은 보통 서버가 TLS 핸드셰이크 중 연결을 끊을 때 발생합니다. 정부 사이트는 종종 특정 TLS 버전/암호군만 허용하거나, SNI/ALPN 요구사항이 까다로울 수 있어요.
- 우선 `curl -v --tlsv1.2 --http1.1 https://...`로 TLS 1.2 + HTTP/1.1 강제 시도해 보세요. 정부 사이트가 HTTP/2에서 연결을 끊는 경우가 있습니다.
- 사이트가 구버전 TLS 또는 특정 암호군만 허용하는 경우 `--ciphers` 옵션으로 서버가 수용하는 스위트에 맞춰야 합니다.
- 중간에 WAF/보안장비가 있는 경우, User-Agent 차단 때문에 끊길 수 있어 `-A "Mozilla/5.0 ..."`로 브라우저 UA를 붙여보는 것도 효과가 있습니다.
- 인증서 체인/루트 문제면 최신 CA 업데이트 또는 `--cacert` 지정이 필요합니다. (다만 `-k`는 테스트 외에는 권장하지 않음)

원하시면:
1) 실제 대상 URL을 알려주시면 해당 사이트 기준으로 `curl` 옵션 조합을 구체적으로 잡아드릴게요.
2) 현재 환경(리눅스 배포판/openssl 버전)을 주시면 TLS 호환성까지 체크해볼게요.

- 사이트가 구버전 TLS 또는 특정 암호군만 허용하는 경우 `--ciphers` 옵션으로 서버가 수용하는 스위트에 맞춰야 합니다.

원하시면:

input: <web-search mcp-server="ydc-server">How do I find information about: pendlay row deficit tutorial youtube 2026?</web-search>
output:
Here are quick ways to find info on “pendlay row deficit tutorial youtube 2026,” plus a few relevant results I found:

- Go straight to YouTube and search: `deficit pendlay row tutorial` or `pendlay row deficit`
- Add year filters with Google: `site:youtube.com "deficit pendlay row" 2026` (helps if/when 2026 content exists)
- Use YouTube filters: Sort by Upload Date, then by Type → Video (exclude Shorts if you want full tutorials)
- Broader technique references: `pendlay row form`, then scan for “deficit” variations

Sample results (current):
- “How To: Deficit Pendlay Row” (YouTube, 2025)
- “Exercise Tutorial - Deficit Pendlay Row” (YouTube, 2021)
- “Snatch Grip Deficit Pendlay Row” (YouTube, 2022)

Want me to refine the search for specific channels or coaches?

input: <web-search mcp-server="ydc-server">Find current information about: CFTC commitments of traders current week report 2025 download txt file</web-search>
output:
The official “current week” COT .txt downloads are on the CFTC COT page. Direct links from the current‑week section (March 18, 2025 on the page I checked):

- Disaggregated futures‑only: https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/f_disagg.txt  
- Disaggregated futures+options: https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/c_disagg.txt  
- Traders in Financial Futures (futures‑only): https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/FinFutWk.txt  
- Traders in Financial Futures (futures+options): https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/FinComWk.txt  
- Legacy futures‑only (comma delimited): https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/deafut.txt  
- Legacy futures+options (comma delimited): https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/deacom.txt  
- Supplemental CIT report (comma delimited): https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/deacit.txt  

Source page: https://www.cftc.gov/MarketReports/CommitmentsofTraders/index.htm
